metadata.title: CVE-2019-2101 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In uvc_parse_standard_control of uvc_driver.c, there is a possibleout-of-bound read due to improper input validation. This could lead tolocal information disclosure with no additional execution privilegesneeded. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android.Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-111760968.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-146-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1107.115
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
